findings.fileName: 211313 - AUTOMATIC FIRE SPRINKLERS.docx
findings.issue: Specifies NFPA 13 2022 edition, but CBC 2022 adopts NFPA 13 2019 edition. Using a newer edition not adopted by CBC may cause DSA rejection or require variance approval.
findings.existingText: Wet pipe fire sprinkler system shall conform to NFPA13, 2022 edition.
findings.replacementText: Wet pipe fire sprinkler system shall conform to NFPA 13, 2019 edition as adopted by CBC 2022.

findings.fileName: 211313 - AUTOMATIC FIRE SPRINKLERS.docx
findings.section: Part 1, DESIGN REQUIREMENTS, Drawings and Hydraulic calculations
findings.issue: Specifies AutoCAD 2019 as the 'latest' version, which is outdated. This creates confusion and may result in compatibility issues with current software versions.
findings.existingText: Drawings shall be made in AutoCAD 2019 version as the latest.
findings.replacementText: Drawings shall be made in AutoCAD format compatible with the current version used by the Architect/Engineer.

findings.fileName: 211313 - AUTOMATIC FIRE SPRINKLERS.docx
findings.issue: References 'Uniform Fire Code with California amendments' which is obsolete. California uses the California Fire Code (CFC), which is based on the International Fire Code, not the Uniform Fire Code.
findings.existingText: Uniform Fire Code with California amendments
findings.replacementText: California Fire Code (CFC) 2022

findings.fileName: 211313 - AUTOMATIC FIRE SPRINKLERS.docx
findings.issue: Section introduction text incorrectly references Section 230548.13 'Vibration Controls for HVAC' which is irrelevant to fire sprinkler specifications. This appears to be leftover boilerplate from HVAC specifications.
findings.existingText: Use this Section if Project is in a seismic area.  Use Section 230548.13 "Vibration Controls for HVAC" for Projects not in a seismic area.

findings.fileName: 211313 - AUTOMATIC FIRE SPRINKLERS.docx
findings.issue: Contains editing notes and placeholders not intended for final specifications: 'Copy "Elastomeric Isolation Pads" Paragraph below and re-edit for each product' and similar instructions. These are clearly residual MasterSpec editing instructions.
findings.existingText:
Copy "Elastomeric Isolation Pads" Paragraph below and re-edit for each product.

The configuration and materials of elastomeric isolation pads depend on the equipment being supported...

findings.fileName: 211313 - AUTOMATIC FIRE SPRINKLERS.docx
findings.issue: Contains editing notes not intended for final specifications: 'Copy "Freestanding, Laterally Stable, Open-Spring Isolators with Vertical-Limit Stop Restraint" Paragraph below and re-edit for each product' - appears to be residual template language unrelated to fire sprinklers.
findings.existingText: Copy "Freestanding, Laterally Stable, Open-Spring Isolators with Vertical-Limit Stop Restraint" Paragraph below and re-edit for each product...

findings.fileName: 211313 - AUTOMATIC FIRE SPRINKLERS.docx
findings.section: Part 2, Wet Pipe System, Article B
findings.issue: References ANSI B16.3 and B16.4 for fittings which have been superseded by ASME B16.3 and ASME B16.4. ANSI designation is outdated.
findings.existingText: Threaded fitting shall be cast iron, class 125, conforming to ANSI B16.3 and ANSI B16.4.
findings.replacementText: Threaded fitting shall be cast iron, class 125, conforming to ASME B16.3 and ASME B16.4.

findings.fileName: 211313 - AUTOMATIC FIRE SPRINKLERS.docx
findings.issue: References ANSI B16.9 for flanged fittings and ANSI B1.20.1 for welded fittings. ANSI designations are outdated; these are now ASME standards.
findings.existingText:
Flanged fittings shall be cast iron, class 125, conforming to ANSI B16.9.

Welded fitting shall be forged steel welding outlet fitting conforming to ANSI B1.20.1
findings.replacementText:
Flanged fittings shall be cast iron, class 125, conforming to ASME B16.9.

Welded fitting shall be forged steel welding outlet fitting conforming to ASME B1.20.1

findings.fileName: 211313 - AUTOMATIC FIRE SPRINKLERS.docx
findings.issue: Reference to '401 canopy type' sprinkler head is unclear - this does not correspond to standard industry nomenclature. May cause confusion during bidding and submittals.
findings.existingText: Sprinklers may be 401 canopy type with head guard installed in ceiling with surface mounted lighting.
findings.replacementText: Sprinklers may be recessed canopy type with head guard installed in ceilings with surface mounted lighting.

findings.fileName: 211313 - AUTOMATIC FIRE SPRINKLERS.docx
findings.issue: References 'CBC standards' for drainage facilities but does not specify the actual drainage requirements from NFPA 13. CBC references NFPA 13 for sprinkler system technical requirements. This vague reference may cause installation deficiencies.
findings.existingText: Sprinkler system shall be provided with complete drainage facilities in accordance with CBC standards.
findings.replacementText: Sprinkler system shall be provided with complete drainage facilities in accordance with NFPA 13 Section 8.16.

findings.fileName: 211313 - AUTOMATIC FIRE SPRINKLERS.docx
findings.issue: Typo: '=ceilings' should be 'ceilings' - contains errant equals sign.
findings.existingText: Exposed pipe through walls and =ceilings shall have split ring chrome escutcheon.
findings.replacementText: Exposed pipe through walls and ceilings shall have split ring chrome escutcheon.

findings.fileName: 211313 - AUTOMATIC FIRE SPRINKLERS.docx
findings.issue: Typo: 'confliction' should be 'conflicts'.
findings.existingText: Contractor shall cooperate and coordinate his work with all other trades to avoid confliction
findings.replacementText: Contractor shall cooperate and coordinate his work with all other trades to avoid conflicts

findings.fileName: 211313 - AUTOMATIC FIRE SPRINKLERS.docx
findings.issue: Typo: 'sloe' should be 'close'.
findings.existingText: He shall sloe all pipe openings with caps or plugs during installation.
findings.replacementText: He shall close all pipe openings with caps or plugs during installation.

findings.fileName: 211313 - AUTOMATIC FIRE SPRINKLERS.docx
findings.issue: Contains editing instruction 'Retain terms that remain after this Section has been edited for a project.' which should not appear in final specifications. This indicates incomplete editing and may cause confusion.
findings.existingText: Retain terms that remain after this Section has been edited for a project.

findings.fileName: 211313 - AUTOMATIC FIRE SPRINKLERS.docx
findings.issue: Article contains text about 'sandwich-core material' and 'elastomeric isolation pads' which are irrelevant to fire sprinkler specifications. This appears to be incorrectly copied content from vibration isolation specifications.
findings.existingText:
Verify availability of various pad materials and their properties with manufacturers.

Copy "Sandwich-Core Material" Subparagraph below and re-edit for each sandwich-core material.  Core materials may not be elastomeric...

findings.fileName: 211313 - AUTOMATIC FIRE SPRINKLERS.docx
findings.issue: Missing requirement for seismic bracing calculations and shop drawings to be prepared and stamped by a California licensed professional engineer, which is required by DSA for fire sprinkler systems in K-12 facilities.
findings.replacementText: Seismic bracing calculations and shop drawings shall be prepared by a California licensed Professional Engineer and submitted for DSA approval prior to installation.

findings.fileName: 220523 fl - General-Duty Valves for Plumbing Piping.docx
findings.issue: References outdated CSI Division numbers: 'Division 2 water distribution piping' and 'Division 15 plumbing piping Sections'. Division 15 was replaced by Divisions 22-23 in the 2004 MasterFormat update.
findings.existingText:
Division 2 water distribution piping Sections for general-duty and specialty valves for site construction piping.

Division 15 plumbing piping Sections for specialty valves applicable to those Sections only.

Division 15 Section "Identification for Plumbing Piping and Equipment" for valve tags and schedules.
findings.replacementText:
Division 33 water distribution piping Sections for general-duty and specialty valves for site construction piping.

Division 22 plumbing piping Sections for specialty valves applicable to those Sections only.

Section 220553 "Identification for Plumbing Piping and Equipment" for valve tags and schedules.

findings.fileName: 220523 fl - General-Duty Valves for Plumbing Piping.docx
findings.issue: References 'Division 1 Specification Sections' which should be 'Division 01 Specification Sections' per current CSI MasterFormat numbering convention.
findings.existingText: Division 1 Specification Sections
findings.replacementText: Division 01 Specification Sections

findings.fileName: 220523 fl - General-Duty Valves for Plumbing Piping.docx
findings.section: Part 1, GENERAL REQUIREMENTS FOR VALVES, Valves for Potable Water
findings.issue: References 'California Lead Free Law, effective January 1, 2010' but cites California Health & Safety Code (116875). The federal Reduction of Lead in Drinking Water Act became effective January 4, 2014, superseding the 2010 California requirement. Reference should be updated.
findings.existingText:
Valves for Potable Water must comply with California Lead Free Law, effective January 1, 2010.

"Lead Free" refers to the wetted surface of pipe, fittings and fixtures in potable water systems that have a weighted average lead content ≤ 0.25%. Source: California Health & Safety Code (116875).
findings.replacementText: Valves for Potable Water must comply with the Federal Reduction of Lead in Drinking Water Act and California Health & Safety Code Section 116875. "Lead Free" refers to the wetted surface of pipe, fittings and fixtures in potable water systems that have a weighted average lead content ≤ 0.25%.
findings.codeReference: Federal Safe Drinking Water Act Section 1417, California HSC 116875

findings.fileName: 220523 fl - General-Duty Valves for Plumbing Piping.docx
findings.section: Part 2, BRONZE BALL VALVES, Article A
findings.issue: Contains editing instruction 'See Editing Instruction No. 1 in the Evaluations for cautions about naming manufacturers. See Division 1 Section "Product Requirements."' which should not appear in final specifications.
findings.existingText: See Editing Instruction No. 1 in the Evaluations for cautions about naming manufacturers.  See Division 1 Section "Product Requirements."

findings.fileName: 220523 fl - General-Duty Valves for Plumbing Piping.docx
findings.section: Part 2, BRONZE GATE VALVES, NRS Bronze Gate Valves
findings.issue: Specifies MSS SP-139 for gate valves, but the typical standard for bronze gate valves is MSS SP-80. MSS SP-139 is for cast iron gate valves. This may be an error.
findings.existingText: Standard:  MSS SP-139, Type 2, NSF 61-G.
findings.replacementText: Standard:  MSS SP-80, Type 2, NSF 61-G.

findings.fileName: 220553 fl - Identification for Plumbing Piping and Equipment.docx
findings.issue: Section title contains typo: 'IDENITIFICATION' should be 'IDENTIFICATION'.
findings.existingText: SECTION 22 05 53 – IDENITIFICATION FOR PLUMBING PIPING AND EQUIPMENT
findings.replacementText: SECTION 22 05 53 – IDENTIFICATION FOR PLUMBING PIPING AND EQUIPMENT

findings.fileName: 220517 fl - Sleeves and Sleeve Seals for Plumbing Piping.docx
findings.issue: References outdated UL Fire Resistance System numbers (WL1146 and CAJ1044). These specific system numbers should be verified as current; UL system numbers are periodically revised. Recommend referencing the general requirement to comply with UL fire-resistance directory listings.
findings.existingText: Sleeves in or through fire rated walls shall be per U.L. Fire Resistance System No. WL1146 for drywall construction, and U.L. Fire Resistance System No. CAJ1044 for concrete construction.
findings.replacementText: Sleeves in or through fire-rated walls shall comply with a UL Fire Resistance Directory listed system appropriate for the wall construction type and required fire rating. Verify current UL system numbers prior to installation.

findings.fileName: 220517 fl - Sleeves and Sleeve Seals for Plumbing Piping.docx
findings.issue: Contains editing note 'PVC sleeves in first paragraph below may be prohibited by fire authorities having jurisdiction' and similar notes that should not appear in final specifications.
findings.existingText: PVC sleeves in first paragraph below may be prohibited by fire authorities having jurisdiction.

findings.fileName: 220517 fl - Sleeves and Sleeve Seals for Plumbing Piping.docx
findings.issue: Contains editing note 'Revise first subparagraph below as required for seismic design conditions. Coordinate sleeve requirements with Section 220719 "Plumbing Piping Insulation."' which should not appear in final specifications.
findings.existingText: Revise first subparagraph below as required for seismic design conditions.  Coordinate sleeve requirements with Section 220719 "Plumbing Piping Insulation."

findings.fileName: 220518 fl - Escutcheons for Plumbing Piping.docx
findings.issue: Contains editing note 'Verify that Section title referenced in this Section is correct for this Project's Specifications; Section title may have changed.' which should not appear in final specifications.
findings.existingText: Verify that Section title referenced in this Section is correct for this Project's Specifications; Section title may have changed.

findings.fileName: 220529 fl - Hangers and Supports for Plumbing Piping and Equipment.docx
findings.issue: References ASCE/SEI 7 without specifying the edition. CBC 2022 adopts ASCE 7-22. This should be specifically stated for DSA compliance.
findings.existingText: Structural Performance:  Hangers and supports for plumbing piping and equipment shall withstand the effects of gravity loads and stresses within limits and under conditions indicated according to ASCE/SEI 7.
findings.replacementText: Structural Performance:  Hangers and supports for plumbing piping and equipment shall withstand the effects of gravity loads and stresses within limits and under conditions indicated according to ASCE/SEI 7-22 as adopted by CBC 2022.

findings.fileName: 220529 fl - Hangers and Supports for Plumbing Piping and Equipment.docx
findings.issue: Missing specific requirement for seismic bracing and restraints per DSA IR A-6. For K-12 projects under DSA jurisdiction, seismic bracing design must comply with DSA Interpretation of Regulations A-6.
findings.replacementText: Seismic bracing and restraints shall comply with DSA IR A-6 and CBC 2022 Chapter 13. Submit seismic bracing calculations stamped by a California licensed Professional Engineer for DSA approval.

findings.fileName: 220529 fl - Hangers and Supports for Plumbing Piping and Equipment.docx
findings.issue: References '2022 California Plumbing Code Table 313.1' for hanger spacing, but Table 313.1 does not exist in CPC 2022. The correct reference is CPC Table 314.1 or general provisions in Section 314.
findings.existingText: Hanger spacing and location shall conform to 2022 California Plumbing Code Table 313.1.
findings.replacementText: Hanger spacing and location shall conform to 2022 California Plumbing Code Section 314.

findings.fileName: 220529 fl - Hangers and Supports for Plumbing Piping and Equipment.docx
findings.issue: Contains editing note 'Paragraph below is defined in Section 013300 "Submittal Procedures" as a "Delegated-Design Submittal." Retain if Work of this Section is required to withstand specific design loads...' which should not appear in final specifications.
findings.existingText: Paragraph below is defined in Section 013300 "Submittal Procedures" as a "Delegated-Design Submittal."  Retain if Work of this Section is required to withstand specific design loads and design responsibilities have been delegated to Contractor or if structural data are required as another way to verify compliance with performance requirements.  Professional engineer qualifications are specified in Section 014000 "Quality Requirements."

findings.fileName: 230529 - HANGERS AND SUPPORTS FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT.docx
findings.issue: References ASCE/SEI 7 without specifying the edition. CBC 2022 adopts ASCE 7-22. This should be specifically stated for DSA compliance.
findings.existingText: Structural Performance:  Hangers and supports for HVAC piping and equipment shall withstand the effects of gravity loads and stresses within limits and under conditions indicated according to ASCE/SEI 7.
findings.replacementText: Structural Performance:  Hangers and supports for HVAC piping and equipment shall withstand the effects of gravity loads and stresses within limits and under conditions indicated according to ASCE/SEI 7-22 as adopted by CBC 2022.

findings.fileName: 230529 - HANGERS AND SUPPORTS FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT.docx
findings.issue: States 'Design seismic-restraint hangers and supports for piping and equipment' but does not reference DSA IR A-6 or specify that calculations must be prepared by a California licensed PE, which is required for K-12 DSA projects.
findings.existingText: Design seismic-restraint hangers and supports for piping and equipment.
findings.replacementText: Design seismic-restraint hangers and supports for piping and equipment in accordance with DSA IR A-6, ASCE 7-22 Chapter 13, and SMACNA Seismic Restraint Manual. Seismic calculations shall be prepared and stamped by a California licensed Professional Engineer and submitted for DSA approval.

findings.fileName: 230529 - HANGERS AND SUPPORTS FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT.docx
findings.issue: Contains multiple editing notes such as 'Trapeze pipe hanger in paragraph below requires calculating and detailing at each use' and similar instructions throughout the document that should not appear in final specifications.
findings.existingText: Trapeze pipe hanger in paragraph below requires calculating and detailing at each use.

findings.fileName: 230553 - IDENTIFICATION FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT.docx
findings.issue: Section is missing the GENERAL header article with RELATED DOCUMENTS reference. Section begins directly with content without proper CSI format introduction.
findings.replacementText:
SECTION 23 05 53 - IDENTIFICATION FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT

PART 1 - GENERAL

1.1 RELATED DOCUMENTS

A. Drawings and general provisions of the Contract, including General and Supplementary Conditions and Division 01 Specification Sections, apply to this Section.

findings.fileName: 230553 - IDENTIFICATION FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT.docx
findings.issue: Contains editing note 'In first paragraph below, describe required label content...' which should not appear in final specifications.
findings.existingText: In first paragraph below, describe required label content.  The objective of labeling equipment is to coordinate it with Drawings, including plans, details, and schedules.  This will allow other information, such as capacities and operating characteristics, to be obtained.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: References ASHRAE/IESNA 90.1 without specifying edition. CBC 2022 and California Energy Code adopt ASHRAE 90.1-2019. Should specify the edition for DSA compliance.
findings.existingText: ASHRAE/IESNA Compliance:  Applicable requirements in ASHRAE/IESNA 90.1, Section 6.7.2.3 - "System Balancing."
findings.replacementText: ASHRAE/IESNA Compliance:  Applicable requirements in ASHRAE 90.1-2019 as adopted by California Energy Code 2022, Section 6.7.2.3 - "System Balancing."

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: References ASHRAE 62.1 without specifying edition. CBC 2022 and CMC 2022 adopt ASHRAE 62.1-2019. Should specify the edition for DSA compliance.
findings.existingText: ASHRAE Compliance:  Applicable requirements in ASHRAE 62.1, Section 7.2.2 - "Air Balancing."
findings.replacementText: ASHRAE Compliance:  Applicable requirements in ASHRAE 62.1-2019 as adopted by CMC 2022, Section 7.2.2 - "Air Balancing."

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: Contains placeholder text '[Architect] [Owner] [Construction Manager] [Commissioning Authority]' throughout document which should be resolved to specific parties.
findings.existingText: [Architect] [Owner] [Construction Manager] [Commissioning Authority]
findings.replacementText: Architect

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: Contains editing notes such as 'First two subparagraphs below may require changes to installed systems or equipment; these changes may require a contract modification' and similar instructions that should not appear in final specifications. These occur throughout.
findings.existingText: First two subparagraphs below may require changes to installed systems or equipment; these changes may require a contract modification.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: Section header is missing. Document begins with 'GENERAL' but lacks the standard CSI section header format 'SECTION 23 05 93 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC'.
findings.replacementText:
SECTION 23 05 93 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC

PART 1 - GENERAL

findings.fileName: 230713 - DUCT INSULATION.docx
findings.issue: Section header is missing. Document begins with 'GENERAL' but lacks the standard CSI section header format.
findings.replacementText:
SECTION 23 07 13 - DUCT INSULATION

PART 1 - GENERAL

findings.fileName: 230713 - DUCT INSULATION.docx
findings.issue: References California Department of Health Services' Standard Practice for VOC testing. This agency is now California Department of Public Health (CDPH). The standard is now CDPH Standard Method v1.2.
findings.existingText: California Department of Health Services' "Standard Practice for the Testing of Volatile Organic Emissions from Various Sources Using Small-Scale Environmental Chambers."
findings.replacementText: California Department of Public Health (CDPH) Standard Method v1.2 for VOC emissions testing.

findings.fileName: 230713 - DUCT INSULATION.docx
findings.issue: Contains editing notes such as 'Retain this article to require shipping container markings' and 'For operating temperatures higher than 250 deg F (121 deg C), use blanket insulation...' throughout the document that should not appear in final specifications.
findings.existingText: Retain this article to require shipping container markings.  Container marking is an option in ASTM standards; default condition does not include the marking in this article unless specified in the Contract.

findings.fileName: 230719 - HVAC PIPING INSULATION.docx
findings.issue: Section header is missing. Document begins with 'GENERAL' but lacks the standard CSI section header format.
findings.replacementText:
SECTION 23 07 19 - HVAC PIPING INSULATION

PART 1 - GENERAL

findings.fileName: 230719 - HVAC PIPING INSULATION.docx
findings.issue: References California Department of Health Services' Standard Practice for VOC testing. This agency is now California Department of Public Health (CDPH). The standard is now CDPH Standard Method v1.2.
findings.existingText: California Department of Health Services' "Standard Practice for the Testing of Volatile Organic Emissions from Various Sources Using Small-Scale Environmental Chambers."
findings.replacementText: California Department of Public Health (CDPH) Standard Method v1.2 for VOC emissions testing.

findings.fileName: 230719 - HVAC PIPING INSULATION.docx
findings.issue: Contains numerous editing notes and instructions such as 'Military Specification in this article was the only standard available when this Section was written', 'For operating temperatures higher than 250 deg F (121 deg C)', etc. throughout the document that should not appear in final specifications.
findings.existingText: Military Specification in this article was the only standard available when this Section was written.  MIL-A-3316C was last updated in October 1987.

findings.fileName: 220517 fl - Sleeves and Sleeve Seals for Plumbing Piping.docx
findings.issue: Requiring 'six (6) copies of valid submittal data' is excessive and outdated in the era of electronic submittals. This increases costs and paper waste unnecessarily.
findings.existingText: Furnish, all at one time, prior to any installation, within the time noted below, six (6) copies of valid submittal data
findings.replacementText: Furnish, all at one time, prior to any installation, within the time noted below, electronic PDF copies of valid submittal data

findings.fileName: 220523 fl - General-Duty Valves for Plumbing Piping.docx
findings.issue: Requiring 'Class 150 valves meeting the valve specifications where Class 125 valves are specified but are not available' is overly prescriptive. If Class 125 is adequate for the application, requiring automatic upgrade to Class 150 increases costs without clear benefit.
findings.existingText: Provide Class 150 valves meeting the valve specifications where Class 125 valves are specified but are not available.
findings.replacementText: Where Class 125 valves are specified but not available, submit proposed substitution with documentation of equivalent or better performance for Engineer approval.

findings.fileName: All Plumbing Specs
findings.issue: Multiple specs still reference 'blueline prints' and 'reproducible tracings' for as-built documentation. These terms are antiquated; modern practice is to require CAD files or BIM models.
findings.existingText: Contractor shall provide and keep up-to-date a complete "as-built" record set of blueline prints
findings.replacementText: Contractor shall provide and keep up-to-date a complete "as-built" record set in electronic CAD format
